snippet: In the 51 years since intergration, the university has made inclusion and racial healing a theme, but problems persist.
abstract: University of Mississippi officials are investigating episode in which audience members heckled performers during theater department's production of play The Laramie Project, about an anti-gay hate crime; incident is seen as sign that school still struggles with the legacy of its integration in 1962, which resulted in two deaths and dozens of injuries.

byline.original: By KIM SEVERSON and ALAN BLINDER
byline.contributor: Kim Severson reported from Oxford, and Alan Blinder from Atlanta.

lead_paragraph: In the 51 years since intergration, the university has made inclusion and racial healing a theme, but problems persist.

headline.main: University of Mississippi Investigating Anti-Gay Heckling at Theater Performance
headline.print_headline: University of Mississippi Investigating Anti-Gay Heckling at Theater Performance
